text:
“Why, are you both joking?” Razumihin asked. 

Raskolnikov raised his pale face. He didn’t reply. 

Porfiry’s sarcasm hung in the air. Razumihin felt uneasy. 

“Brother, if you’re serious…” he continued. 

“Only a few are independent,” Raskolnikov finally said. 

“Perhaps one in ten thousand,” he added softly. 

Razumihin frowned. “That’s not new.” 

“What’s original?” Porfiry challenged. 

Raskolnikov stared into the distance, lost in thought.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The text discusses the rarity of individuals with true independence and genius among the vast majority of humanity, suggesting that a natural law governs this phenomenon.
